item.title: 美联储主席洛根呼吁加强利率控制工具
item.description: 达拉斯联邦储备银行行长洛里-洛根（Lorie Logan）表示，美国央行应考虑加强在市场紧张时期防止货币市场利率飙升的机制。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Lorie Logan said the US central bank should consider strengthening the mechanisms by which it keeps money-market interest rates from spiking during times of market stress.】

item.title: 美元 "财政皱眉 "理论令德意志银行发出亏损警告
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank）全球外汇策略主管乔治-萨拉维洛斯（George Saravelos）表示，无论美国政府陷入财政危机还是经济衰退，美元都面临损失的风险。【原文：The dollar is at risk of losses whether the US government lands in a fiscal crisis or a recession, according to George Saravelos, Deutsche Bank’s global head of FX strategy.】

item.title: 参议员要求美国证券交易委员会调查反对 JBS 美国上市的咨询公司
item.description: 肯塔基州参议员兰德-保罗（Rand Paul）要求美国最高证券监管机构对两家大公司进行调查，这两家公司建议其客户投票反对全球最大的肉类生产商 JBS SA 在纽约上市的提议。【原文：Kentucky Senator Rand Paul has asked the top US securities regulator to probe two major firms that have advised their clients to vote against a proposed New York listing by JBS SA, the world’s largest meat producer.】

item.title: 西伯特认为，在波动中，小额贷款借款人会向银行提出更多要求
item.description: Siebert Williams Shank & Co.公司基础设施和公共财政主管加里-霍尔（Gary Hall）表示，州和地方借款人在选择市政债券交易承销商时，对华尔街银行提出了更高的要求。【原文：State and local borrowers are asking more of Wall Street banks when they select underwriters for municipal-bond deals, according to Gary Hall, the head of infrastructure and public finance at Siebert Williams Shank & Co.】

item.title: 道达尔能源公司与加拿大拟建场址签署液化天然气新协议
item.description: 道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies SE）与加拿大液化天然气出口的一个拟议项目签署了一项新的长期协议，加强了这家法国能源巨头在全球的液化天然气燃料组合。【原文：TotalEnergies SE signed a new longterm deal with a proposed project for Canadian liquefied natural gas exports, bolstering the French energy major’s global portfolio of the fuel.】

item.title: 竞争对手环伺，亿万富翁德拉希考虑出售 SFR
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，亿万富翁帕特里克-德拉希（Patrick Drahi）的法国阿尔迪斯公司（Altice France SA）正在考虑出售 SFR 的控股权，因为买家对这笔交易很感兴趣，包括债务在内，该法国移动运营商的估值可能高达 300 亿欧元（340 亿美元）。【原文：Billionaire Patrick Drahi’s Altice France SA is considering the sale of a controlling stake in SFR amid buyer interest in a deal that could value the French mobile carrier at as much as €30 billion ($34 billion) including debt, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国指责美国对华为芯片发出警告破坏贸易谈判
item.description: 中国政府指责特朗普政府警告说，在 "世界任何地方 "使用华为技术有限公司的人工智能芯片都将违反美国的出口管制，从而破坏了最近在日内瓦举行的贸易谈判。【原文：The Chinese government accused the Trump administration of undermining recent trade talks in Geneva with its warning that using Huawei Technologies Co.’s artificial-intelligence chips “anywhere in the world” would violate US export controls.】

item.title: 力拓与 Codelco 风险投资公司达成另一项锂交易
item.description: 力拓集团同意投资一个由 Codelco 公司控制的智利锂项目，这家全球第二大矿业公司将继续向电池金属领域扩张。【原文：Rio Tinto Group agreed to invest in a Chilean lithium project controlled by Codelco as the world’s second-biggest miner continues its expansion into the battery metal.】

item.title: 吉姆-米尔斯坦称，如果经济衰退来临，美国将面临 "财政灾难 "风险
item.description: 古根海姆证券公司（Guggenheim Securities）联席主席吉姆-米尔斯坦（Jim Millstein）认为，华盛顿的立法者们如果继续推行他们的全面减税方案，一旦经济衰退来临，他们将面临 "财政灾难 "的风险。【原文：Washington lawmakers are risking a “fiscal disaster” if a recession hits as they plow on with their package of sweeping tax cuts, according to Guggenheim Securities Co-Chair Jim Millstein.】

item.title: 加里波罗誓言提高巴西利率并延长其期限，推动了对周期结束的押注
item.description: 巴西央行行长加布里埃尔-加利波罗（Gabriel Galípolo）表示，巴西需要在更长时间内将利率维持在非常严格的水平，这令投资者对决策者可能在 6 月份举行的下一次会议上停止当前的紧缩周期更加笃定。【原文：Central bank President Gabriel Galípolo said Brazil needs interest rates to remain at a very restrictive level for longer, boosting investors’ bets that policymakers could stop the current tightening cycle at their next meeting in June.】

item.title: 加纳与非洲进出口银行就 7.68 亿美元债务发生争执
item.description: 加纳刚刚经历了伤痕累累的债务重组过程，又面临着与非洲进出口银行（加纳最大的商业债权人之一）关于是否应承担 7.684 亿美元债务损失的争议。【原文：Ghana, emerging from a bruising debt restructuring process, faces a dispute with African Export-Import Bank, one of its biggest commercial creditors, over whether it should take losses on a $768.4 million liability.】

item.title: 阿美石油公司、沙特电信与红杉共同支持美国初创企业 Graphiant
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯石油和电信巨头的风险投资部门投资了美国科技初创公司 Graphiant Inc.【原文：The venture capital arms of Saudi Arabia’s oil and telecom giants have invested in US tech startup Graphiant Inc. as the kingdom seeks to drive innovation and develop its digital economy.】

item.title: 微软正在将埃隆-马斯克的人工智能模型引入其云系统
item.description: 微软公司正在将埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 xAI 模型加入其人工智能市场。【原文：Microsoft Corp. is adding models from Elon Musk’s xAI to its artificial intelligence marketplace.】

item.title: 摩根大通为 FanDuel 的 Snaitech 交易提供 5 亿美元贷款
item.description: 据一位知情人士透露，摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. launched a $500 million leveraged loan to support FanDuel owner Flutter Entertainment Plc’s purchase of Playtech Plc’s Italian gambling business, according to a person with knowledge of the deal.】

item.title: 穆迪下调美国评级后抵押债券基本未受影响
item.description: 在穆迪评级公司上周末下调美国房利美（Fannie Mae）和房地美（Freddie Mac）等政府支持公司的抵押贷款债券评级后，这些债券的交易价格在周一上午略有上涨。【原文：Mortgage bonds supported by government-backed companies like Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac were trading slightly wider Monday morning after Moody’s Ratings downgraded the US late last week.】

item.title: 赤道几内亚赢得与加蓬争端中的岛屿权利
item.description: 在赤道几内亚与加蓬的长期领土争端中，联合国一高级法院做出了有利于赤道几内亚的裁决，将位于几内亚湾潜在石油资源丰富水域的三个小岛的主权判给了赤道几内亚。【原文：A top United Nations court ruled in favor of Equatorial Guinea in a long-running territorial dispute with Gabon, awarding it sovereignty over three small islands located in potentially oil-rich waters in the Gulf of Guinea.】

item.title: 美国共和党目标提前结束税收抵免，太阳能公司业绩下滑
item.description: 共和党保守派议员表示，他们已得到领导层的承诺，将提前终止关键的清洁能源税收抵免，这是旨在让唐纳德-特朗普总统的巨额税收和支出方案得以推进的全面协议的一部分，此后太阳能公司股价下滑。【原文：Shares of solar companies slumped after conservative Republican lawmakers said they had secured a commitment from leadership to end key clean-energy tax credits earlier than planned, part of a sweeping deal aimed at allowing President Donald Trump’s giant tax and spending package to advance.】

item.title: 关于穆迪下调评级
item.description:
Tracy 和 Joe 不同意

。【原文：

Tracy and Joe disagree

item.title: 哥伦比亚投资者看淡财政困境，购买长期债券
item.description: 投资者纷纷涌入期限较长的哥伦比亚债券市场，赌市场已经过度解读了古斯塔沃-彼得罗总统的预算困境所带来的风险。【原文：Investors are jumping into longer-dated Colombia bonds, wagering that the market has overshot the risks associated with President Gustavo Petro’s budget woes.】

item.title: 路透社称新日铁计划在美国投资 140 亿美元
item.description: 据路透社报道，如果特朗普政府批准两家公司合并，新日本钢铁公司计划向美国钢铁公司投资 140 亿美元。【原文：Nippon Steel Corp. plans to invest $14 billion in United States Steel Corp. if the Trump administration approves the merger of the companies, Reuters reported.】

item.title: 继谷歌之后，Salesforce 下调面向美国政府的 Slack 价格
item.description: Salesforce Inc. 将以折扣价向联邦政府提供其 Slack 应用程序，这是特朗普政府为削减技术成本而降价的最新一家软件公司。【原文：Salesforce Inc. will offer its Slack application to the federal government at a discounted rate, the latest software company to cut prices as the Trump administration aims to slash technology costs.】

item.title: KKR 的目标是在恢复计划中削减泰晤士水务公司 80 亿英镑的债务
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，KKR & Co. 公司的目标是削减泰晤士水务公司约 80 亿英镑（107 亿美元）的债务，作为其扭转这家陷入困境的英国公用事业公司的计划的一部分。【原文：KKR & Co. aims to slash about £8 billion ($10.7 billion) of Thames Water’s debt as part of its plan to turn around the beleaguered British utility, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 澳大利亚巨型养老基金增至八家，资金总额达 2.7 万亿美元
item.description: 澳大利亚蓬勃发展的 4.2 万亿澳元（2.7 万亿美元）养老金行业的增长将另一家公司推向了所谓的巨型基金类别，这进一步表明该国不断膨胀的退休基金正被最大的公司所主导。【原文：Growth in Australia’s booming A$4.2 trillion ($2.7 trillion) pensions industry pushed another firm into the so-called mega fund category, a further sign of the country’s swelling retirement pot becoming dominated by the biggest players.】

item.title: 杰斐逊称美联储政策处于 "非常好的位置"，可以耐心等待
item.description: 美联储副主席菲利普-杰斐逊（Philip Jefferson）表示，央行必须确保华盛顿政策变化导致的任何价格上涨都不会导致通胀持续上升。【原文：Federal Reserve Vice Chair Philip Jefferson said the central bank must ensure any price increases resulting from policy changes in Washington don’t lead to a persistent rise in inflation.】

item.title: 威廉姆斯称美联储需要在 6 月和 7 月之后才能获得更清晰的前景
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）表示，决策者可能需要几个月的时间才能更好地了解经济前景。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said policymakers may need months to get a better understanding of the outlook for the economy.】

item.title: Leapmotor 力争今年通过海外销售实现收支平衡
item.description: 浙江跃马科技股份有限公司（Zhejiang Leapmotor Technology Co. Ltd.）在第一季度成功收窄亏损后，今年的目标是实现收支平衡。【原文：Zhejiang Leapmotor Technology Co. aims to break even this year after managing to narrow losses in the first quarter, helped by more electric vehicle shipments overseas.】

item.title: 穆迪下调信用评级，美国资产受挫，S&P 500 指数暴跌
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）下调美国政府信用评级，再次对美国资产造成压力，导致美国股市下跌，国债收益率上升。【原文：US stocks fell and Treasury yields rose as a downgrade from Moody’s Ratings on the US government’s credit rating renewed pressure on American assets.】

item.title: 中国称美国芯片管制破坏贸易共识
item.description: 中国商务部发言人表示，中国认为美国破坏了两国在日内瓦贸易谈判期间达成的共识。【原文：China sees the US as undermining the consensus reached between the two countries during trade talks in Geneva, a spokesperson for the Asian nation’s commerce ministry says.】

item.title: 摩根大通认为美国降级刺激了对高等级债务的需求
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：High-grade corporate bonds are likely to grow more attractive to fund managers as bond yields are pushed higher following the US losing its last top credit grading, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会将研究私人基金投资规则
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（Securities and Exchange Commission）正在重新审视那些增加了私募基金投资难度的规定。【原文：The Securities and Exchange Commission is taking a fresh look at rules that make it harder to invest in private funds.】
